title: David Weidong LIN | Web Directory | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: Dr David Lin is passionate about applied teaching and learning in areas of industrial & systems engineering, systems modelling and simulation. He has been actively involved in the continued educational teaching and advocates lifelong applied learning by adding value to self and contributing to society. Areas of interests include simulation based lean and six sigma framework for productivity and process improvement, systems modelling and simulation for both manufacturing and services, Industry 4.0 cyber physical digital twin system. Dr Lin believes human knowledge is created through the transformation of experiences and the rapid changing industry is the driving force of applied research and applied learning.

is passionate about applied teaching and learning in areas of industrial & systems engineering, systems modelling and simulation. He has been actively involved in the continued educational teaching and advocates lifelong applied learning by adding value to self and contributing to society. Areas of interests include simulation based lean and six sigma framework for productivity and process improvement, systems modelling and simulation for both manufacturing and services, Industry 4.0 cyber physical digital twin system. Dr Lin believes human knowledge is created through the transformation of experiences and the rapid changing industry is the driving force of applied research and applied learning.
Programme Leader, Bachelor of Science with Honours in Digital Supply Chain
PhD in Industrial and Systems Engineering

Senior Supply Chain Consultant, Motorola Electronics Singapore, 2006 – 2009.
SIMTech Technology Infusion Programme (TIP) Course Leader, Optimisation and Simulation Technologies, 2005 to 2006.
Part-time Lecturer and Thesis Moderator for Multimedia University MBA Course, 2004 to 2006.
Part-time Lecturer for NTU Master Course, Intelligent Optimization Systems, 2003 to 2006.
NTU Master / FYP Students co-supervisor, 2001 to 2006.
Senior Research Engineer, Singapore Manufacturing Technology Institute (SIMTech), A*STAR, 1999 to 2006.
Industry 4.0 Cyber Physical Digital Twin Simulation for Manufacturing, Logistics and Supply Chain

With emerging of Industry 4.0, it creates the new transformation journey by using simulation in conjunction with IoT, Artificial Intelligence, Block Chain etc. resulting digital twin of the physical product or processes. With digital twin, companies can analyze and diagnose the operation process in real-world operating conditions, optimize its performance and maintenance in real time, and make confident predictions about future performance to improve productivity, reduce the cost, and risk of unplanned downtime.
Logistics Digital Twin (LDT) System for Sustainability Management

The Logistics Digital Twin (LDT) concept framework aims to overcome the information limitations of current logistics system, such as lacking valid real-time data for sustainability traceability and assessment.
Digital Twin Simulation of Production Line in Semiconductor Manufacturing
A real-world semiconductor production case study will be defined for testing the Digital Twin system.
An Industry 4.0 Cyber-Physical Digital Twin System for Manufacturing

A project with a major contract manufacturer, successfully delivering on a 2.5-year-long project. The industry collaborator adopted the project outcomes and employed the student and research engineer. The project results were used for the development of a new undergraduate module.
